bibl.title: Albert Rhude v. A.P. Hotaling Company of Puget Sound. Letter from Sheriff
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

person.persName: A.P. Hotaling Company of Puget Sound

div1.ab: In the District Court holding terms at Seattle
In the matter of the application of Albert Ehude for a writ of habeas corpus
div1.p:
And now comes J.H. McGraw, Sheriff of King County Washington Territory. Its restraint it in its above entitled came and by may of return to the writ issued in said came says that he has the said petitioner in his custody and detains him under and by virtue of this certain warrant, of arrest issued in a certain came in this court maintains the A.P. Hotaling Comapny of Puget Sound is plaintiff and said petitioner defendant. and number 4184 on the docket of said Court said warrants having been issued under and by virtue of an order of said Court made on the 7th day of November 1884. That the first of said warrants was issued
on the 7th day og November 1884 and delievered to the Sheriff of Pierce County Washington Territory and until the return of said Sheriff now appears in the life of said cause; that said semmed warrant was issued on the 8th day of November 1884 to this new precinct and said new precinct now produces the same in Court. And said refers to and makes a point of this return each and every of this pleading and other papers in said cause and the records and proceedings herein.
Wherefore he prays that said writ of habeas corpus may be denied, and said petitioner returned to his custody and that he may have and under him curls and distiniguished herein.
